people.name: James E. O'Hara
people.description: James Edward O'Hara  was an American politician and attorney who in 1882, after Reconstruction, was the second African American to be elected to Congress from North Carolina.

people.name: George Luther Stearns
people.description: George Luther Stearns  was an American industrialist and merchant, as well as an abolitionist and a noted recruiter of blacks for the Union Army during the American Civil War.

people.name: John Adams
people.description: John Adams  was an American lawyer, author, statesman, and diplomat.

people.name: Gil Dozier
people.description: Gilbert Lynel "Gil" Dozier , was an attorney, businessman, farmer, and rancher who served from 1976 to 1980 as the Louisiana Commissioner of Agriculture and Forestry.

people.name: Yitzhak Shamir
people.description: Yitzhak Shamir  was an Israeli politician and the seventh Prime Minister of Israel, serving two terms, 1983–84 and 1986–1992.

people.name: Ira W. Wood
people.description: Ira Wells Wood  was an American Republican Party politician who represented New Jersey's 4th congressional district from 1904 to 1913.

people.name: Walter Pidgeon
people.description: Walter Davis Pidgeon  was a Canadian American actor who starred in many films, including How Green Was My Valley, Mrs.

people.name: Cass Ballenger
people.description: Thomas Cass Ballenger  was an American politician.

items.name: Electoral history of Ronald Reagan
items.description: It is a photograph about Electoral history of Ronald Reagan. In a corner, it says:This is the electoral history of Ronald Reagan.  Reagan, a Republican, served as the 40th President of the United States  and earlier as the 33rd Governor of California .   There are things written behind: New Alliance Party Republican Party (United States) American Independent Party  And the following places: the United States and New York City

items.name: Ronald Reagan presidential campaign, 1980
items.description: It is a book about Ronald Reagan presidential campaign, 1980. It says: Ronald Reagan, the 33rd Governor of California , announced his candidacy for President of the United States in New York City on November 13, 1979.   The following people are mentioned:  Republican Party (United States)  And the following place: the United States

items.name: VII Paralympic Games
items.description: It is a book about VII Paralympic Games. It says: The 1984 International Games for the Disabled, canonically the 1984 Summer Paralympics were the seventh Paralympic Games to be held.   The following people are mentioned:  New_York_City Cerebral palsy Stoke Mandeville United States United Kingdom New York City

items.name: Republican Party
items.description: It is a letter about Republican Party. It says: The Republican Party, commonly referred to as the GOP , is one of the two major contemporary political parties in the United States, the other being its historic rival, the Democratic Party.   The following people are mentioned:  Ira W. Wood Walter Pidgeon   And the following place: the United States
